alert.note: Alert for Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Coastal San Patricio; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 8:50AM CST until January 15 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TO 11 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, significant icing. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 degrees. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 15 degrees. * WHERE...Jim Wells, Inland Kleberg, Inland Nueces, Inland San Patricio, Coastal Kleberg, Coastal Nueces and Coastal San Patricio. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 3 PM CST this afternoon. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM to 11 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 11 PM this evening to 11 AM CST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Coastal San Patricio; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells
